page.title: 03Customs.
page.content: People feel that the following local customs should be preserved. The Whit Walks, Stalybridge Carnival, Wakes Holidays and the Whit Brass Band Contest. The Whit Walks should be kept because of the local tradition and family spirit. One lady wrires, ' Whit Walks should be kept on Whit Friday and the Band Contests should be kept on Whit Friday starting at 5 p.m. I have got vivid memories of happy Whit Fridays with the family, full of enjoyment. On May 1st, all the children in the street dressed up and walked all round Stalybridge, ending up at Mrs. Sammer's J.P., on Mottram road, for sixpence, and doing a Maypole Dance on the lawn. On Whit Sunday, all the children wore new clothes and visited everybody in the street, as well as their relations. They were given money
